Name: Ahmad 'Ali As'ad 'Ashirat Salah
Notes: Shot dead by soldiers along with another minor near the Separation Barrier, according to the military after they threw Molotov cocktails at Route 60. In a video published on social media, an ambulance is seen at the site and gunfire is heard. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Khaled 'Alian 'Issa
Notes: Shot dead by soldiers along with another minor near the Separation Barrier, according to the military after they threw Molotov cocktails at Route 60. In a video published on social media, an ambulance is seen at the site and gunfire is heard. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ibrahim 'Imad Ahmad Hamran
Notes: Shot by soldiers while standing on a hill together with four other teens and throwing stones at military vehicles withdrawing from the nearby town of Qabatiyah. Soldiers got out of the vehicles, chased the teens through olive groves and fired at them. The other boys fled toward the town. About an hour after the shooting, paramedics arrived at the site and the soldiers directed them to Hamran’s body. They took him to a hospital, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Ibrahim Majed 'Ali Naser
Notes: Shot by soldiers who raided a house at the entrance to the town. Naser and two other minors threw stones at the military jeep parked near the house. He was shot and injured and fled into an olive grove, where he fell down. He was taken by paramedics to a hospital in Jenin, where he was pronounced dead. The two other minors fled the site. CCTV footage shows soldiers chasing the youths and firing.

Name: Muhammad Khaled Hassan Mabruk
Notes: Shot and injured in the thigh by Israeli forces who raided the city of Nablus for about twenty hours to arrest a Palestinian, while he was standing in an alley at the entrance to the camp together with his cousin, a minor. A military, Border Police and Shin Bet force raided a house in the city, detonated explosives nearby and arrested its owner. The forces raided the Rafidiya and al-Arabi hospitals searching for the wanted man, who was later arrested. During the raid, clashes broke out in various parts of the city, in which Palestinians threw stones at the forces. While a military jeep and a Border Police jeep were driving, forces fired at people standing at the camp entrance, injuring Mabruk and another Palestinian. A resident carried him on foot to an ambulance waiting nearby. Died of his wounds about three days later at al-Arabi Hospital.

Name: 'Amru 'Ali Ahmad Qabha
Notes: Shot by soldiers who got out of two military vehicles that entered the northern part of the town. Qabha, who was walking along the street, tried to escape when he noticed the soldiers, who called on him to stop, and they began shooting at him. His father arrived and approached him, and soldiers assaulted him, tied his hands, and seated him next to his dying son. For about half an hour, the soldiers prevented an ambulance at the site from evacuating him. Pronounced dead at a medical center in the town.

Name: Iyad 'Abd al-Mu'ti Iyad Shalakhti
Notes: Injured by soldiers' gunfire together with two other minors while throwing stones during the withdrawal of Israeli forces from Nablus. Taken by private car to Rafidiya Hospital in the city, where he died of his wounds about three days later. Two other minors were injured by the soldiers' gunfire.

Name: Amjad Nassar Shihadah 'Awwad
Notes: Shot by soldiers while participating in clashes at Manara Square in the city center, in which youths threw stones and fired fireworks at the soldiers. The clashes broke out after military and police counterterrorism (Yamam) forces raided a house on a nearby street, interrogated a Palestinian and arrested him. Afterwards, the forces raided another house in the Ein Musbah neighborhood in the northwest of the city and arrested four Palestinian citizens of Israel who had fled to Ramallah on criminal grounds. Evacuated by ambulance to a hospital in the city, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Rayan Tamer Anwar Hushiyeh
Notes: Shot by soldiers who climbed onto the roof of a building in the center of the town during clashes that developed after they entered and surrounded a house to arrest a Palestinian. During the clashes, Palestinians threw stones and IEDs at the soldiers. Hushiyeh was trying to cross the road on his way home with his cousin, a minor, when he was shot by the soldiers. He was taken by residents to a nearby ambulance and then to a clinic in the town, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: 'Ammar Mu'taz Mustafa Hamayel
Notes: Shot in the back by soldiers after he threw a stone at an armored vehicle coming from the direction of Route 449. His friend, a minor, who was with him fled the scene after seeing Hamayel fall. Hamayel was evacuated, deceased, in a Palestinian ambulance that arrived at the scene following coordination with the DCO, and pronounced dead at a hospital in the city of Ramallah.

Name: Yusef Fouad 'Abd al-Karim Fuqaha
Notes: Shot by soldiers in ambush in farm fields near Rotue 5056, and evacuated in a military vehicle from which he was transferred to an Israeli ambulance. After the shooting, soldiers raided a house overlooking the spot where the shooting took place, viewed the security camera footage, and then deleted it. According to the military, Fuqaha tried to throw stones at the road. However, according to the witness with the security cameras, the footage showed he did not hold or throw any stones. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Nidal Wael 'Abd al-Karim a-Shaghnubi
Notes: Shot by soldiers from an ambush while throwing stones on Highway 60 along with two other minors who were injured, fled, and were evacuated by local residents to ambulances waiting in the nearby village of ‘Asirah a-Shamaliyah, which took them to a hospital in the city of Nablus. Locals searching for a-Shaghnubi were unable to get close due to the presence of soldiers, who fired in the air and prevented his evacuation by ambulance. About two hours after the shooting, the Palestinian DCO was informed that a-Shaghnubi had died of his wounds. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Nidal Majed Abu Libdah
Notes: Shot by Israel Police officers at Bab al-Silsila (the Gate of the Chain in Temple Mount) in the Old City of Jerusalem. The police claimed he was shot after stabbing and moderately wounding a police officer. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Rida Mahmoud Kamal Bani 'Odeh
Notes: Killed along with four other Palestinians, during a fire exchange with soldiers who raided the town, surrounded the three-story building in which they had barricaded themselves and fired shoulder-fired missiles at it. During the operation, the Israeli forces destroyed a significant portion of the building, rendering it uninhabitable. At the end of the operation, a military bulldozer scooped Bani ‘Odeh’s body and three others into its bucket and drove with them in it through the streets of the town and nearby communities. According to the military, four Palestinians were arrested in the town and the nearby city of Tubas during the raid. Bani ‘Odeh was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Abd al-Khaleq Mus'ab 'Abd al-Khaleq 'Abd al-Khaleq
Notes: Shot in the chest after closing his family's grocery store when military jeeps were reported in the village. Soldiers who got out of the jeeps approached the grocery store under cover of a grove and shot him from a distance of about 50 meters immediately after he stepped out. When some young men tried to evacuate him, the soldiers ordered them to back away, and allowed his evacuation only after trying unsuccessfully to provide first aid, but then blocked the path of the car in which he was being evacuated, forcing the driver to take a detour. ‘Abd al-Khaleq was pronounced dead in a hospital in Nablus.

Name: Mahmoud Mithqal 'Ali Abu al-Heija
Notes: Shot by soldiers who raided a house in the southern neighborhood of the town, while throwing stones at the house along with other minors from a distance of about 50 meters. Taken by car to the clinic in town and then by ambulance to a hospital in the city of Jenin, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Jihad Adham 'Abdallah 'Adili
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in ambush along with another Palestinian, while the two were throwing stones at Route 505. A third Palestinian who was with them was unharmed. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Malek 'Ali Ibrahim Hattab
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers on a balcony on the second floor of a building on the main street in the camp, as he tried to escape with other youths from two military jeeps after some youths threw stones at them. A woman in a nearby house tried to rescue Hattab but was forced to return home because of the shooting. Two more Palestinians were wounded by the soldiers’ fire, including a minor. Hattab was taken to al-Istishari Hospital in the city of Ramallah where he underwent surgery, but after several hours, the doctors were forced to pronounce him dead.

Name: 'Amer Muhammad Sa'adah Rabi'
Notes: פלסטיני בעל אזרחות אמריקאית. נורה בידי חיילים ממארב יחד עם שני נערים נוספים, שנפצעו מהירי ונמלטו, לאחר שלפחות אחד מהשלושה יידה ככל הנראה אבן לעבר כביש 60, ממטע בקצה העיירה. חבריו לא יכלו לפנותו משום שהירי נמשך. החיילים ניסו ככל הנראה להגיש לו עזרה ראשונה אך הוא מת מפצעיו. גופתו נלקחה מהמקום בידי החיילים ונמסרה באותו ערב לאביו ולצוות הסהר האדום במחנה הצבאי חווארה.

Name: 'Omar 'Amer Yasser Zyud
Notes: Shot in the back by soldiers at the entrance to town. Zyud and other young men threw stones and IEDs at two armored military vehicles that entered the town, and the soldiers fired at them from a machine gun mounted on one of them and left the scene a few minutes later. Two more minors were injured by soldiers' gunfire at the scene, and another Palestinian was injured by gunfire during clashes that developed in another neighborhood in the town. Zyud was taken by ambulance to Ibn Sina Hospital in the city of Jenin, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Hamed Muhammad Fadel Nazzal
Notes: Shot by soldiers while throwing stones at the Eyal checkpoint along with several other teens. According to Palestinian paramedics who evacuated him, deceased, about 15 minutes after the shooting, the soldiers provided no care.

Name: Ayman Nassar Muhammad Taysir al-Haymuni
Notes: He was injured by soldier gunfire when he and his younger brother left their grandfather's house and went toward their uncle's house. Soldiers who approached him did not provide him with medical treatment, delayed his evacuation for a short time, and fired at a relative who tried to evacuate him. The soldiers then left the scene. Al-Haymuni was taken to a hospital in a relative's car, where doctors tried unsuccessfully to perform CPR on him and had to pronounce him dead.

Name: Rimas 'Omar Muhammad 'Amuri
Notes: Injured in the back by soldiers’ gunfire while on her way from her home to a neighbor’s house during Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. The soldiers continued to fire at the location as family members tried to evacuate her. The evacuation succeeded only several minutes after the shooting stopped, and ‘Amuri was pronounced dead upon arrival at the hospital.

Name: Muhammad Ghassan Abu 'Abed
Notes: Fatally shot along with a Palestinian minor in a fire exchange between them and Israeli soldiers who raided the camp during Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. Another Palestinian was killed earlier in a fire exchange. According to the military, a soldier was moderately injured. Abu 'Abed was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ahmad 'Abd al-Halim Shaker Sa'di
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft that hit a group of people standing near his home. Two of his relatives were injured. Several hours later, the army fired another missile at a nearby location, killing two of his relatives while they were riding a motorcycle. The attack was carried out as part of Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. Israeli armed forces were present in the city and the camp at the time, but not in the vicinity of the incident.

Name: Diyaa 'Omar Ahmad Saba'anah
Notes: Injured along with his father when a missile fired from an aircraft struck a car that passed by them while they were sitting in their car near their grocery store during Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. The two Palestinians who were traveling in the car at which the missile was aimed were killed. Saba’anah was taken to a hospital, where he was hospitalized for about two weeks before succumbing to his wounds.

Name: Jihad Naser Yusef Bani Matar
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft with nine other Palestinians, including a pair of siblings, while sitting in a yard belonging to one of them, during Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. Another Palestinian was wounded in the attack. Bani Matar was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Sadam Hussein Iyad Muhammad Rajab
Notes: Wounded in the back by soldiers’ gunfire while standing near his front entrance. Rajab was taken to the hospital in an ambulance, while the soldiers detained his father and other neighbors who came to help him, arresting three of them. He underwent surgery at the hospital, but succumbed to his wounds 10 days later. The military initially claimed that 10-year-old Rajab was “messing with the ground in a suspicious way.” Israeli soldiers killed another Palestinian in another neighborhood of Tulkarm on the same day.

Name: Adam Majdi Ahmad Sub Laban
Notes: Wounded by undercover Border Police gunfire together with two other Palestinians, after, according to the police, they threw an explosive device at the officers near a checkpoint. Taken to a hospital in Ramallah, where he died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Layla Muhammad Ayman al-Khatib
Notes: Wounded in the head while sitting in her mother’s lap by shots fired by Israeli soldiers who had entered the street in unmarked vehicles and took over a nearby home. The family, who had heard gunfire in the street, sat down to eat their evening meal on the floor, fearing bullets would enter the house. Al-Khatib’s mother and aunt were also injured. She was driven to a medical center in nearby Qabatiyah. An ambulance then took her to a hospital, where attempts to save her failed and she was pronounced dead. The military claimed the soldiers believed an armed Palestinian was in the home and called for the occupants to vacate it over loudspeakers prior to firing. The family say they did not hear such a call.

Name: Mu'taz 'Imad Musa Abu Tabikh
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by Israeli forces while riding an electric bicycle in the al-Ghabaz neighborhood, in an area where no clashes were taking place, when Israeli forces raided Jenin and Jenin R.C. on the first day of Operation Iron Wall in the northern West Bank. Taken to Ibn Sina hospital in the city, where he died of his wounds shortly after. That day, Israeli forces killed nine more Palestinians, including a minor, in Jenin and Jenin R.C.. The Israeli forces killed another Palestinian in the nearby village of T'innik and wounded forty others, including a physician and a nurse.

Name: Ahmad Rashid Rushdi Jazar
Notes: Wounded by Israeli soldiers' gunfire from a distance of about 300 meters, when he and other children pointed a laser pen at them, after the soldiers entered the town’s western neighborhood in a military jeep and fired two shots that did not hit anyone. Jazar was driven to a hospital in Nablus, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Mahmoud Ashraf Mustafa Gharbiyah
Notes: Killed by missiles fired from an aircraft along with four armed Palestinians, including three brothers and another Palestinian, as they sat around a campfire on a-Sikkah Street in the center of the camp, where the electricity supply was cut off a month earlier. Four other Palestinians were wounded. No Israeli forces were present at the scene, and no clashes were taking place.

Name: Rida 'Ali Ahmad Bsharat
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while playing on the street with his 10-year-old cousin, during a raid on the town and other nearby communities. The other cousin and another adult cousin who was sitting near them were also killed. During the raid, fire exchanges developed in other parts of the town. After the missile strike, soldiers arrived, removed the family members and took the three bodies. The bodies were returned to the family later that day through the Palestinian DCO. The military claims the three were misidentified as laying explosive devices.

Name: Hamzah 'Ammar Ahmad Bsharat
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while playing on the street with his eight-year-old cousin, during a raid on the town and other nearby communities. The other cousin and another adult cousin who was sitting near them were also killed. During the raid, fire exchanges developed in other parts of the town. After the missile strike, soldiers arrived, removed the family members and took the three bodies. The bodies were returned to the family later that day through the Palestinian DCO. The military claims the three were misidentified as laying explosive devices.

Name: Suliman Mustafa Suliman Qatishat
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with another Palestinian, while the two tried to plant explosive devices. The military claims they were armed. The incident took place when Israeli security forces raided the town and nearby al-Far’ah R.C. and arrested Palestinians. In clashes that broke out during the raid, Palestinians fired and threw IEDs at the Israeli forces, and a military bulldozer destroyed a fence and roads. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Mu'taz Ahmad 'Abd al-Wahab Madani
Notes: Shot in the back after throwing stones at military jeeps that entered the camp along with a group of minors. Shortly before the shooting, another teen threw an IED at the jeeps. Madani was taken to Rafidya Hospital in Nablus, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Rayan Husam Mustafa Bani 'Odeh
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while with another minor who was severely injured during clashes that developed between Israeli forces who raided the town and Palestinians who fired and threw IEDs at them. According to the military, Bani ‘Odeh and other Palestinians had planted an IED.

Name: Muhaymin Ayman Majed al-Akhras
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with three other armed Palestinians during a raid on the camp by Israeli forces. Another Palestinian was killed during clashes, in which Palestinians threw stones and IEDs at the Israeli forces and fired at them, and two women were killed in their homes by another missile. Al-Akhras was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: 'Omar Husam Ya'qub Shweiki
Notes: Shot by undercover Border Police officers, while, according to the police, throwing stones at passing vehicles. Evacuated in an ambulance to a hospital where he died of his wounds later that day. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Rabi' Jamil Hamarshah
Notes: Shot by soldiers from inside a military jeep along with another Palestinian, while the two were throwing IEDs at the jeep as it entered the town, along with other youths. After the shooting, the jeep drove up to the wounded along with another jeep. Soldiers who came out of them shot and killed one of the wounded, as he screamed and begged them not to shoot him.

Name: Nur Ahmad Mustafa 'Arafat
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire after throwing stones with other youths at armored military jeeps that entered and patrolled the town. Security camera footage shows ‘Arafat fleeing with the other youths, being shot and falling. He was taken to Rafidya Hospital in the city, where he was pronounced dead.

Name: Naji Nidal Naji Zama'arah
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers in ambush along with his friend, a minor, who was wounded by the fire and escaped. The two had been throwing stones at Route 60 from a distance of about 100 meters. His body was transferred to the Red Crescent shortly after.

Name: 'Abdallah Jamal Nidal Hawash
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers while throwing stones, on his own, at a convoy of armored jeeps that were traveling on the street near his home on their way out of Nablus, after arresting a Palestinian in the Old City.

Name: Rayan Ibrahim Hassan a-Sayed
Notes: Shot by soldiers from a military jeep, while throwing stones and an IED at armored military vehicles passing by on the street, along with other youths who had come out of schools, which were ordered to shut down due to a military and Border Police raid on the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. The Israeli forces killed another Palestinian in a fire exchange during the raid.

Name: Hatem Sami Hisham Gheith
Notes: Shot by Border Police officers who got out of their vehicle and fired two bullets from 30-35 meters away at a group of youths and children who were throwing stones at them. The incident occurred during clashes that developed between the Palestinians and Israeli military, Border Police and plainclothes intelligence officers who raided nearby Qalandiya R.C. In video footage, Gheith is seen picking up an object, apparently a stone, from the ground, then running away with the other youths. After taking a few steps, he is shot and collapses on the ground. He was pronounced dead at a hospital shortly after.

Name: Muhammad Maamun Muhammad 'Anbas
Notes: Killed by missiles fired from an aircraft at a three-story building in a targeted killing that killed all 18 Palestinians in the building, including two other minors. 'Anbas and 13 other Palestinians, including a minor, were killed in a café on the ground floor of the building. His sister, their husband and their two children were killed in the apartment next door. According to the military, Palestinian operatives of armed groups who were in the café were planning an attack on Israeli civilians. ‘Anbas was a Hamas military wing operative.

Name: Sham Muhammad Salah Abu Zahrah
Notes: Killed with her parents and brother, a minor, in their apartment when missiles fired from an aircraft hit their three-story residential building. The missile was fired as part of a targeted killing in which all 18 Palestinians in the building were killed, including another minor. The other 14 casualties, including a minor, were killed in a café on the ground floor of the building. According to the military, Palestinian operatives of armed groups who were in the café were planning an attack on Israeli civilians.

Name: Karam Muhammad Salah Zahrah
Notes: Killed with his parents and sister, a minor, in their apartment when missiles fired from an aircraft hit their three-story residential building. The missile was fired as part of a targeted killing in which all 18 Palestinians in the building were killed, including another minor. The other 14 casualties, including a minor, were killed in a café on the ground floor of the building. According to the military, Palestinian operatives of armed groups who were in the café were planning an attack on Israeli civilians.

Name: Hassan Yusef Hassan a-Sha'er
Notes: Fatally shot by Israeli forces or security guards near the Ni’lin/Hashmonaim checkpoint. B’Tselem has no information about the circumstances of the case. Israel held his body until 15 October 2024.

Name: Hani Majdi Majed Taha
Notes: Shot in the chest by a Border Police officer while he and a friend were in an alley near an area where clashes broke out between youths from the camp and Israeli armed forces who entered it and arrested two Palestinians. Another Palestinian was wounded during the clashes. According to the police, the forces fired at youths who had fired and thrown an explosive device at them.

Name: Tawalbah Mahmoud Jamil Bsharat
Notes: Killed together with four other Palestinians by a missile fired from an aircraft while they were gathered in the street during a raid by military, Border Police, Shin Bet and IPS forces on the nearby city of Tubas, town of Tammun and al-Far’ah R.C. According to the military, they were armed with explosive devices. Eight other people were wounded in the attack, and at least two more Palestinians were wounded and one was killed by Israeli armed forces’ fire in al-Far’ah R.C. during the raid, which lasted two days. The forces also arrested five Palestinians in Tubas and Tammun. Bsharat was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Bana Amjad Baker Lbum
Notes: Wounded in the chest by soldiers’ gunfire while watching clashes between Palestinians and Israeli soldiers on a nearby street. The soldiers had entered the village after settlers attacked it with stones, injuring a local Palestinian resident. Another Palestinian was wounded by soldiers’ gunfire earlier. She was pronounced dead at the hospital soon after.

Name: Majed Fidaa 'Abd al-Qader Abu Zeinah
Notes: Fatally shot by a member of an IPS special unit during a night raid by Israeli armed forces on the city, as he left his home with another person, who escaped. The IPS officer first shot Abu Zeinah in the leg. After he fell down, he forced him to remove some of his clothing and then shot him again. The Israeli forces prevented an ambulance that arrived at the scene from approaching Abu Zeinah. Then his body was removed from the site by a military bulldozer and abandoned at a remote location. According to the military, Abu Zeinah was carrying an explosive device and was killed in a fire exchange. B'Tselem's investigation indicates that clashes developed during the raid on the city of Tubas and al-Far’ah R.C., including, among other things, explosive-device throwing and fire exchanges, but no fire exchange was taking place at the site where Abu Zeinah was killed. Five other Palestinians were killed that day in the city of Tubas by a missile fired from an aircraft. Others were injured, and one died of his wounds several days later.

Name: Lujayn Ousamah 'Abd a-Ra'uf Musleh
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers who surrounded her neighbors' house during Operation Summer Camps, while watching events on the street from her window. The ambulance that took her to the hospital was detained by Israeli forces for several minutes on the way to her home and again on the way to the hospital.

Name: Muhammad 'Abdallah Muhammad Kan'an
Notes: Shot in the head and torso by Israeli armed forces while returning with his father, who was injured on the side of his body, to their home in Tulkarm R.C., having thought the Israeli forces that raided it as part of Operation Summer Camps had retreated.

Name: Layth Marwan 'Abdallah Shawahaneh
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while on the street with another Palestinian who was seriously injured in an attack that took place as part of Operation Summar Camps in the northern West Bank. According to the military, the two had thrown explosives at Israeli forces that had entered the village.

Name: 'Abdallah Naser 'Abdallah Ma'sud
Notes: Shot all over his body, including the head, by Israeli soldiers when he, his adult brother and his cousin who is a minor and was also killed, flipped over on a motorcycle on which they were fleeing from military vehicles that were chasing them during a raid of the area as part of Operation Summer Camps. The three were on their way home after buying bread. The soldiers prevented a Red Crescent ambulance team from reaching him and his cousin and arrested his adult brother.

Name: Muhammad Mahmoud 'Abdallah Ma'sud
Notes: Shot in the face and upper body by Israeli soldiers when he, and his two cousins, one a minor who was also killed, flipped over on a motorcycle on which they were fleeing from military vehicles that were chasing them during a raid of the area as part of Operation Summer Camps. The three were on their way home after buying bread. The soldiers prevented a Red Crescent ambulance team from reaching him and his cousin (a minor) and arrested his adult cousin.

Name: Muhammad Ma'sud Muhammad Na'jah
Notes: Killed along with his brother, also a minor, by a missile fired at their house from an aircraft, while they were sleeping on the roof due to the summer heat. Their adult brother, who was sleeping next to them, was injured in the strike, and their father was injured by missile fragments on the first floor. Two more Palestinians who were near the home were also killed in the strike and six were injured. The attack was carried out as part of Operation Summar Camps in the northern West Bank. The military claims the four dead men were armed and posed a threat to Israeli forces on the ground. B’Tselem’s research indicates otherwise. Their bodies were removed about six hours later, after soldiers arrived, went up to the roof to look at them.

Name: Murad Ma'sud Muhammad Na'jah
Notes: Killed along with his brother, also a minor, by a missile fired at their house from an aircraft, while they were sleeping on the roof due to the summer heat. Their adult brother, who was sleeping next to them, was injured in the strike, and their father was injured by missile fragments on the first floor. Two more Palestinians who were near the home were also killed in the strike and six were injured. The attack was carried out as part of Operation Summar Camps in the northern West Bank. The military claims the four dead men were armed and posed a threat to Israeli forces on the ground. B’Tselem’s research indicates otherwise. Their bodies were removed about six hours later, after soldiers arrived, went up to the roof to look at them.

Name: 'Adnan Aysar 'Adnan Jaber
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with four other armed Palestinians, including another minor, in the camp’s al-Manshiyah neighborhood. No Israeli forces were present in the area and no clashes or fire exchanges were taking place. The military claims the attack targeted a “war room in the area.”

Name: Muhammad Ahmad Muhammad 'Alian
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with four other armed Palestinians, including another minor, in the camp’s al-Manshiyah neighborhood. No Israeli forces were present in the area and no clashes or fire exchanges were taking place. The military claims the attack targeted a “war room in the area.”

Name: Mus'ab Hassan 'Ali Mqasqas
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with his friend while driving through Ariel Junction. According to the military, the two had driven against traffic and tried to run over soldiers, injuring one lightly. In a recorded message his friend posted minutes before his killing, he said they were lured to the site by a request for help from a man who said he was a Palestinian citizen of Israel, but discovered that he was actually an Israeli Jew. The friend said that at that point, the forces on site began chasing them. Mqasqas was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Khalil al-'Antir
Notes: Shot by soldiers after arriving by car with two other Palestinians, who were arrested. The three stopped the vehicle and fired at a military base near the checkpoint. Israel apprised the Palestinian DCO that he had died of his wounds a short while later. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Bashar Hassan Bani 'Odeh
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft along with three other Palestinians, who, according to the military, were armed, during a raid by soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel on the town and the nearby city of Tubas and al-Far'ah R.C. During the raid, the Israeli forces killed another Palestinian in Tubas, after surrounding his house and arresting three Palestinians. According to the military, four soldiers were injured in the clashes that developed due to the raid. The media reported their injuries were light to moderate. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Shadi Wisam Muhammad Shiha
Notes: Wounded by a Border Police officer’s gunfire at his family’s car wash, where he was watching a fire that broke out near the separation fence as a result of Molotov cocktails thrown from somewhere nearby. Taken to hospital, where he died of his wounds. The military claims he was shot while climbing the separation fence and throwing Molotov cocktails. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Tareq Ziad 'Abd a-Rahim Dawood
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at the end of a chase after shooting and wounding an Israeli citizen who entered Qalqiliyah to have his car fixed. According to media reports, he also killed two Palestinians who were at the site. Dawood was a Hamas military wing operative. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Khatab Majdi As'ad Abu Badawiyah
Notes: Killed by missiles fired from an aircraft while on the street with other Palestinians, four of whom were instantly killed. Another was injured and died of wounds the next day. All six fired or threw IEDs. Video footage released by the military shows two of the dead on a scooter and two injured armed men near them. Clashes broke out in the camp, during which Palestinians threw IEDs and fired at the Israeli forces.

Name: Bilal 'Iz a-Din Ahmad Sawaftah
Notes: Shot in the abdomen and shoulder by soldiers and undercover Border Police officers near the Turkish Hospital in the city, while waiting, along with other locals, in the hospital’s square, for the bodies of three Palestinians killed by Israeli forces in the nearby town of ‘Aqqabah. Clashes broke out in the area between residents and retreating Israeli forces.

Name: Muhammad Murad Muhammad Jaradat
Notes: Shot in the head by soldiers, according to the military, after trying to stab them at the Beit ‘Einun junction. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Luai Muhammad Mustafa Masheh
Notes: Wounded on the street by a missile fired from an aircraft during a raid of the camp. The military claims the missile was fired at armed operatives. A volunteer paramedic was also killed by the missile strike, and 27 Palestinians were injured by the missile or by soldier gunfire in clashes that developed at various locations during the raid. One of them also died of his wounds shortly after. Mashah was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: 'Ali Hassan 'Ali Rabaiya'h
Notes: Shot while throwing stones along with other minors at military jeeps passing through the western entrance to the village after having arrested Palestinians in a nearby village. Two of the jeeps stopped when an armed Palestinian located far from the minors fired at them and fled. The soldiers fired at the group of minors. Another teen was wounded and died of his wounds on 23 July 2024, and, according to the media, five other teens were wounded.

Name: Seif Ziad 'Ali 'Amer
Notes: Shot while throwing stones along with other minors at military jeeps passing through the western entrance to the village after having arrested Palestinians in a nearby village. Two of the jeeps stopped when an armed Palestinian located far from the minors fired at them and fled. The soldiers fired at the group of minors. Another teen was wounded and died of his wounds shortly after, and, according to the media, five other teens were wounded.

Name: Muhammad Sarhan 'Ali 'Omar Sarhan
Notes: Shot by Israeli armed forces on the street. Security camera footage shows Sarhan, masked, attempting to find cover and then being shot and falling. The forces destroyed infrastructure in nearby Nur Shams Refugee Camp earlier, where a soldier was killed by and IED at the start of the raid. Clashes developed between them and Palestinians, during which armed Palestinians fired at the forces. During the raid, in nearby Tulkarm Refugee Camp, a woman was killed and another was injured by a missile that was fired from an aircraft and landed on their roof.

Name: Na'im 'Abd al-Ilah Na'im Samha
Notes: Shot by soldiers after throwing stones at them along with other minors, and then escaping. The soldiers entered the city to confiscate security cameras on the main street, where an Israeli citizen was attacked earlier, and, according to media reports, died due to a cardiac event. Samha died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Sultan 'Abd a-Rahman Sultan Khatatbeh
Notes: Shot by soldiers and Border Police officers while throwing stones at them along with other youths, after the forces entered the town. Two more Palestinians were wounded by the Israeli forces’ fire. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Muhammad Murad Sa'id Hushiyeh
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by shots fired by soldiers who raided a car wash, fired at an employee, severely wounding him as well. According to media reports, the soldiers were searching for a Palestinian driving a suspected stolen vehicle who hit a soldier at the Rantis checkpoint. Hushiyeh was on his way home when he noticed the soldiers and started running to get away from them, near a site where Palestinians were throwing stones at them. The soldiers delayed Hushiyeh’s evacuation for about 20 minutes. Later, the soldiers fired at another Palestinian, an American citizen, who was driving past a military jeep, severely wounding him.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Khalil Samudi
Notes: Shot by soldiers in the back of the neck, chest, arm, abdomen and leg, when throwing an IED at them during clashes in which Palestinians also fired at the soldiers. The clashes developed after the soldiers entered the city and surrounded a home where armed Palestinians barricaded themselves. While in the town, the Israeli forces killed five more Palestinians. In a video posted on social media, Samudi is seen being shot twice while lying wounded on the ground.

Name: Mahmoud Ibrahim Muhammad Nabrisi
Notes: Shot in the head by soldiers when warning residents that a military force had entered the camp. The military claimed he was armed. In the clashes that followed, which included stone-throwing and shooting by Palestinians at the soldiers, four Palestinians were injured and four others were arrested. During the raid, military bulldozers destroyed infrastructure in the camp.

Name: 'Issa Nafez Musa Jallad
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers from inside a military jeep along with his friend, when the two were riding a motorcycle about 600 meters from the cinema square in the city, where clashes between Palestinians and Israeli soldiers were underway following a military raid on Jenin R.C. Jallad and his friend apparently passed by a military jeep, which gave chase. The chase ended after about 130 meters when the soldiers fired at the two from inside the jeep from a distance of about 15 meters. The two fell to the ground, and then the jeep slowed down next to them, turned around and drove away. During the operation in Jenin R.C. that day, soldiers killed an Islamic Jihad military wing operative and arrested another Palestinian.

Name: Ahmad Ashraf Walid Hmeidat
Notes: Shot by soldiers along with another minor near the fence that separates the camp from the settlement of Vered Yeriho, around the camp’s cemetery, during clashes that developed in the camp, in which Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at Israeli armed forces. According to the military, the two had thrown Molotov cocktails at the settlement. They were arrested after being wounded, and shortly thereafter, the military announced the death of the second minor. The military announced Hmeidat’s death the next day.

Name: Muhammad Musa Muhammad Nabil Bitar
Notes: Shot by soldiers along with another minor near the fence that separates the camp from the settlement of Vered Yeriho, around the camp’s cemetery, during clashes that developed in the camp, in which Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at Israeli armed forces. According to the military, the two had thrown Molotov cocktails at the settlement. They were arrested after being wounded, and shortly thereafter, the military announced his death. The military announced the second minor’s death the next day.

Name: Majd Shaher Isma'il al-'Aramin
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at the Beit ‘Einun intersection, after, according to the military, attempting to stab them. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Mahmoud Fares Mahmoud al-Qarini
Notes: Shot in the armpit by Israeli forces while throwing explosive devices at them along with other youths near the Muqat’ah in the city of Jenin, during clashes that developed after military, Border Police and Shin Bet forces raided the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. During the raid, which lasted about two days, Israeli forces killed 11 more Palestinians and wounded at least 15. Another Palestinian was seriously injured in an explosion when the military vehicle in which she was being transported to detention drove over an explosive device. She died of her wounds on 5 August 2024.

Name: Wasim 'Ahed Mahmoud Jaradat
Notes: Fatally shot by Israeli forces while holding an explosive device at the western entrance to the city of Jenin during clashes that developed after military, Border Police and Shin Bet forces raided the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. During the raid, which lasted about two days, Israeli forces killed 11 more Palestinians and wounded at least 15. Another Palestinian was seriously injured in an explosion when the military vehicle in which she was being transported to detention drove over an explosive device. She died of her wounds on 5 August 2024.

Name: Ousamah Muhammad Na'im 'Abd a-Latif Hajir
Notes: Shot by Israeli armed forces from the roof of a building while riding a scooter, during a raid of the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. by military, Border Police and Shin Bet forces. During the raid, Israeli forces killed 11 more Palestinians and wounded at least 15. Another Palestinian was seriously injured in an explosion when the military vehicle in which she was being transported to detention drove over an explosive device. She died of her wounds on 5 August 2024.

Name: Mahmoud Amjad Isma'il Hamadnah
Notes: Shot by Israeli forces from the roof of a building under construction while riding an electric bicycle home from school. Students were dismissed early due to the military, Border Police and Shin Bet raid on the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. During the raid, which lasted about two days, Israeli forces killed 11 more Palestinians and wounded at least 15. Another Palestinian was seriously injured in an explosion when the military vehicle in which she was being transported to detention drove over an explosive device. She died of her wounds on 5 August 2024.

Name: Nur Nizar Adib a-Shihabi
Notes: Shot by Border Police officers after stabbing one of them near the police station on Salah a-Din Street. Died of his wounds shortly after. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Khaled Raed Suliman 'Aruq
Notes: Shot in the upper body by Israeli forces during clashes that developed after soldiers, Border Police and Shin Bet personnel entered a building in the city to deliver a punitive demolition order to one of the families. ‘Aruq threw stones at the forces along with other youths and then hid behind a tree. He was shot when he came out of his hiding place.

Name: Qays Fathi Ibrahim Nasrallah
Notes: Wounded in the chest by shots fired by soldiers and Border Police officers while watching military vehicles driving to the nearby Nur a-Shams R.C., at the beginning of a raid on the camp that lasted for about two days. Security camera footage shows passersby walking on the road, and Nasrallah, who was standing with an electric scooter, being hit by a bullet and falling to the ground. Died of his wounds shortly after. During the raid, 13 more Palestinians were killed in the camp, including a Palestinian citizen of Israel, and about 40 were wounded. According to the Israeli military, eight members of the armed forces were wounded.

Name: 'Ali Muhammad 'Ali 'Abdallah
Notes: Killed during a fire exchange with Israeli soldiers and Border Police officers who entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. The Israeli forces also fired anti-tank missiles at the building where he was barricaded together with other Palestinians. During the raid that lasted for about two days, 12 more Palestinians were killed in the camp, including a Palestinian citizen of Israel, and about 40 were wounded. On their way to the camp, the Israeli forces killed another Palestinian in the city of Tulkarm. According to the Israeli military, eight members of the armed forces were wounded. 'Abdallah was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Yazan Muhammad Fawzi Shtayeh
Notes: Shot in the chest by undercover Border Police officers while throwing stones at them during clashes that broke out after the undercover officers entered the city together with soldiers and arrested a Palestinian. The military claims Shtayeh threw explosive devices at the forces. At least two more Palestinians were injured by the Israeli forces’ fire.

Name: Asma 'Imad Sa'ed Daraghmeh
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a checkpoint after advancing towards them, holding a knife, and, according to the military, attempting to stab them. Israel is holding her body.

Name: al-Mu'tasem bi-Allah Nabil Subhi Hamamdi
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers, while participating in clashes during which Palestinian youths threw stones, improvised explosive devices and Molotov cocktails at soldiers who had entered the town and arrested Palestinians. At least two more Palestinians were wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire in the clashes. One of them died of his wounds on 2 April 2024.

Name: 'Abdallah Mahmoud Muhammad Rashid (al-Qaysi)
Notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ fire, while participating in a fire exchange. During the fire exchange, Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. Another Islamic Jihad military wing operative, who was a Palestinian citizen of Israel, was also wounded in the fire exchange. Both were pronounced dead shortly after. Two other operatives, including a minor, were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft, after, according to the military, throwing explosive devices.

Name: Iyad Nidal 'Azmi Kanuh
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft together with another Islamic Jihad military wing operative, while participating in clashes, during which Palestinians fired and threw stones and explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. According to the military, the two had thrown explosive devices. Two other operatives, one of them a minor and the other a Palestinian citizen of Israel, were wounded in the clashes and died shortly after.

Name: Mustafa Taleb Ahmad Ahmad
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers after, according to the military, arriving at a checkpoint on an electric bicycle, stabbing a soldier and a security guard who, according to the media, were lightly to moderately wounded. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Abdallah Maamun Hassan 'Assaf
Notes: Wounded by Border Police officers, while he and four other Palestinians who had arrived at the Separation Fence near Route 436 by car began unloading Molotov cocktails. All four were wounded by the gunfire. One of them was killed instantly. The Border Police officers fired from an ambush, at close range, and from several directions. ‘Assaf and the remaining wounded were detained for several hours before being transferred to Palestinian ambulances at al-Jib Checkpoint (Giv'at Ze’ev). ‘Assaf died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Rami 'Ali Muhammad Hamdan
Notes: Wounded by Border Police officers’ gunfire while launching fireworks at the military tower at the checkpoint along with other minors. In video footage posted on social media, Hamdan is seen lighting a firework, and then being shot and falling to the ground. Died of his wounds shortly after. Israel held his body until 18 March 2024.

Name: Muhammad Hisham Shihadah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers staffing a military post at the intersection, after, according to the military, stabbing one of them and severely wounding him. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Amru Muhammad Ghaleb Najjar
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire, while traveling in a car with his father and younger brother. Some youths threw stones at the soldiers, who entered the village in three military jeeps, and responded with gunfire that hit a-Najar. The soldiers held up the car in which residents tried to take him to get medical treatment, and he died shortly after. During their incursion into the village, the soldiers shot and wounded another youth, who died on 7 March 2024, assaulted three other residents, including a minor, and arrested a minor.

Name: Muhammad Murad Hassan Ghneim
Notes: Wounded in the head by shots fired by soldiers in ambush, while standing and talking to his brother and another minor, on their way home, thinking the military had withdrawn from the village. Earlier, Palestinian youths gathered and some of them threw stones at military jeeps that entered the village and drove around in it. The soldiers prevented Ghneim’s evacuation for several minutes. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Muhammad Khaled Taher Zeid
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers from inside the settlement of Beit El. According to a friend who was with him and was injured by fragments, the two were sitting near the fence. According to the military, Zeid was shot after he threw a Molotov cocktail into the area of the settlement. The military held his body for about an hour, and then left it on the ground and notified the Palestinian DCO about its location.

Name: Bashar Nihad 'Abd a-Latif Hanani
Notes: Wounded by Israeli soldiers’ gunfire while throwing stones at them along with other youths as the soldiers were entering the village.

Name: Nur a-Din Ibrahim Muhammad Yasin
Notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire while participating in clashes that developed after they entered the camp and arrested a Palestinian. During the clashes, Palestinians threw stones and improvised explosive devices at the Israeli forces and fired at them.

Name: Sa'id Raed Muhammad Jaradat
Notes: Wounded on the street by a missile fired from an aircraft at a car in which a senior Islamic Jihad operative was traveling. The operative died on the spot. 16 other Palestinians were wounded by the gunfire, including an Islamic Jihad military wing operative. Died of his wounds on 26 February 2024.

Name: Fadi Sa'id Kamal Suliman
Notes: Shot in the shoulder by soldiers while on the street throwing stones at them from a rooftop. The soldiers entered the town after some youths threw an improvised explosive device at Route 55. After the shooting, the soldiers prevented his evacuation for at least half an hour. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Nayhal Ziad Muhammad Breighith
Notes: Wounded in the head by shots fired by soldiers and Border Police officers who entered the town when school let out and students threw stones at the Israeli forces. Died of his wounds shortly after. According to media reports, 18 more Palestinians were wounded by the Israeli forces' fire, at least nine of them minors. 11 were wounded by live fire and seven by rubber coated metal bullets.

Name: Muhammad Tareq Salim Abu Sneineh
Notes: Wounded by Border Police officers’ fire after, according to the police, trying to stab them on al-Wad (HaGuy) Street. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Muhammad Ahmad Muhammad Khaddur
Notes: Shot in the head by Israeli armed forces who were on the other side of the separation fence while driving home with a friend who is a minor from a hike in woods located about 100-150 meters from the separation barrier. The friend fled on foot to a nearby village and returned to the car with some youths who helped him take al-Khaddur to an ambulance that was waiting for them. He was pronounced dead at the hospital.

Name: Mu'az Ashraf Fateh Bani Shamsah
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire while throwing stones at them along with other youths after the soldiers entered the town. While in the town, the soldiers shot and wounded two other youths and arrested two others. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Wadi' Shadi Sa'ed 'Alian
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers while fleeing them after attempting to stab one of them when the two officers were standing on the road next to their vehicle. Security camera footage shows the officers firing at ‘Alian as he lies wounded on the ground. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman 'Abd a-Rahim Suliman Hamed
Notes: Fatally shot by a police officer from a jeep, from about 100 meters away, while walking home from school. Hamed was shot on the street, near the hiding spot of some youths who, shortly before, threw stones at Israel Police, Border Police and military forces that entered the city. The Israeli forces were roaming the streets of the town, shouting provocations on a loudspeaker, stopping residents and passersby and firing tear gas. The police claimed Hamed threw a Molotov cocktail at the Israeli forces.

Name: Yamen Muhammad Mustafa As'ad Lahluh
Notes: Shot in the abdomen by soldiers when throwing stones at them during clashes in which other Palestinians threw improvised explosive devices at the soldiers.

Name: Ahmad Musa Mutlaq al-Bidu
Notes: Killed along with three other Palestinians, including two other minors, by a missile fired from an aircraft when they were near armed Palestinians who fired and threw explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed four others in the city and the refugee camp, including a Hamas military wing operative, who was shot during a fire exchange, a Palestinian who was standing on his rooftop watching the clashes that developed following the raid, a Palestinian who threw an explosive device during the clashes, and a Palestinian who drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

Name: Ahmad Tareq Nu'man Faraj
Notes: Killed along with three other Palestinians, including two other minors, by a missile fired from an aircraft when they were near armed Palestinians who fired and threw explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed four others in the city and the refugee camp, including a Hamas military wing operative, who was shot during a fire exchange, a Palestinian who was standing on his rooftop watching the clashes that developed following the raid, a Palestinian who threw an explosive device during the clashes, and a Palestinian who drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

Name: Walid Ibrahim Muhammad Ghanem
Notes: Killed along with three other Palestinians, including two other minors, by a missile fired from an aircraft when they were near armed Palestinians who fired and threw explosive devices at soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet personnel who raided the camp and the city of Tulkarm. During the raid, which lasted about two days, the forces arrested at least seven Palestinians and killed four others in the city and the refugee camp, including a Hamas military wing operative, who was shot during a fire exchange, a Palestinian who was standing on his rooftop watching the clashes that developed following the raid, a Palestinian who threw an explosive device during the clashes, and a Palestinian who drove through the area where the clashes were taking place. According to media reports, a soldier was severely wounded by shots fired by armed Palestinians during the clashes.

Name: Suliman Muhammad Suliman Kan'an
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire when he tried to get out of a car to evacuate his friend who was fatally shot by soldiers in ambush after throwing an improvised explosive device at a military base. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Khaled 'Amer Khaled Hmeidat
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in ambush, after getting out of a car near a military base and throwing an improvised explosive device at the base. His friend, a minor, who remained in the car, tried to get out to evacuate him. He was shot and taken to hospital, where he died of his wounds shortly after. Two ambulances arrived at the scene but soldiers prevented their teams from evacuating Hmeidat and fired at them, smashing a light in one of the ambulances. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Luai Majed Salim a-Sufi
Notes: Resident of Jordan. Shot in the chest by soldiers while on the street in an area where clashes broke out. A-Sufi did not participate in the clashes. During the clashes, youths threw stones at soldiers who had entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. A-Sufi was visiting relatives in the camp with his mother.

Name: Mahmoud 'Arafat Yusef Abu Jheishah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with his two cousins, one of whom was also a minor, after they entered the settlement and, according to the military, fired at soldiers patrolling there, causing light to moderate injuries to one of them. Israel is holding his body.

Name: 'Udai Isma'il Yusef Abu Jheishah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers along with his two cousins, one of whom was also a minor, after they entered the settlement and, according to the military, fired at soldiers patrolling there, causing light to moderate injuries to one of them. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Wadi' Yasser Hassan 'As'us
Notes: Injured by a missile fired from an aircraft while participating in clashes that included stone, improvised explosive device and Molotov cocktail throwing as well as shooting at military and Border Police vehicles that entered the camp. Died of his wounds shortly after. Six other Palestinians were killed on scene by the missile strike, including his brother. During the clashes, a Border Police officer was killed by an explosive device and three others were injured.

Name: Ruqayah Ahmad 'Odeh Jahalin
Notes: Wounded by Border Police officers’ gunfire at a checkpoint while riding in a shared taxi with her mother and siblings. The officers fired at a couple who broke through the checkpoint in their car and ran over a female officer, who was lightly injured. The couple were killed on scene. Israel held her body until 16 January 2024.

Name: Usayed Tareq Anis Rimawi
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen by soldiers’ gunfire while trying to evacuate a wounded man together with another young man, who was also wounded. Died of his wounds shortly after. Security camera footage shows Rimawi and other youths being shot by soldiers in ambush while standing on the road. Two other young men were wounded by gunfire while trying to escape. About 90 minutes before the ambush shooting, village residents threw stones and Molotov cocktails at military jeeps and set tires on fire throughout the village.

Name: Mahmoud 'Othman Muhammad Warni
Notes: Wounded in the abdomen and thigh by soldiers' gunfire near the separation fence in town, while trying to escape after throwing stones together with other youths at the military tower following a demonstration against the war in Gaza. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: 'Ammar Muhammad 'Abd al-Fatah Abu Hussein
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers in his car after running over five soldiers at a military post. According to the military, one of the soldiers was seriously injured and the others were lightly to moderately injured. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Ahmad 'Abd a-Rahman 'Issa Saleh
Notes: Killed, along with 12 other Palestinians, by a missile fired from an aircraft while they were in al-Mahjar neighborhood, watching clashes that developed about 100 meters away after Israeli forces entered the camp. During the clashes, Palestinians threw stones and improvised explosive devices at the Israeli forces and fired at them. The military claimed explosive devices were thrown from his location, but B’Tselem’s research revealed a Palestinian threw an explosive device 50 meters away from where he and others were standing, and then fled to a forest about 250 meters away. Border Police officers delayed the ambulances that came to evacuate the wounded for about an hour. Five more Palestinians, including another minor, were killed, and six others were injured by the Israeli forces' fire.

Name: Hamzah Ahmad Mustafa Fahmawi
Notes: Killed, along with 12 other Palestinians, by a missile fired from an aircraft while they were in al-Mahjar neighborhood, watching clashes that developed about 100 meters away after Israeli forces entered the camp. During the clashes, Palestinians threw stones and improvised explosive devices at the Israeli forces and fired at them. The military claimed explosive devices were thrown from his location, but B’Tselem’s research revealed a Palestinian threw an explosive device 50 meters away from where he and others were standing, and then fled to a forest about 250 meters away. Border Police officers delayed the ambulances that came to evacuate the wounded for about an hour. Five more Palestinians, including another minor, were killed, and seven others were injured by the Israeli forces' fire.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Yusef Yaghi
Notes: Wounded by shots fired by Israeli forces from the roof of an unfinished building while on his neighbors’ roof, watching clashes that broke out after the forces entered the camp. Palestinian youths threw stones and launched firecrackers at the forces during the clashes. Yaghi was evacuated in a car because the military blocked the entrance to the camp and ambulances could not reach him. Died of his wounds shortly after. Another Palestinian was fatally shot on the roof of his house.

Name: Rashed Habib Ahmad 'Aydi
Notes: Shot in the shoulder while watching, with other residents, clashes that erupted near his home between local residents and soldiers who entered the camp and arrested a Palestinian. During the clashes, in which Palestinians threw stones and explosive devices at the soldiers and fired at them, another minor, who was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative, was killed while throwing an improvised explosive device. Two brothers were killed while participating in a fire exchange with the soldiers.

Name: Yazan Mu'in Muhammad Khatib
Notes: Shot in the head while throwing an improvised explosive device during clashes that erupted between local residents and soldiers who entered the camp and arrested a Palestinian. Two brothers were killed while participating in a fire exchange with the soldiers and another minor was killed while watching the clashes near his home. Khatib was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: 'Atallah Ziad 'Atallah Badahah
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers while present in an area where clashes erupted between them and Palestinian youths who threw stones at them as they retreated from Deir ‘Ammar R.C. According to the military, the forces entered the camp during a chase after Palestinians who threw Molotov cocktails at them. Soldiers at a fly checkpoint detained the car in which Badhah was evacuated for about 10 minutes. Died of his wounds shortly after. Two more Palestinians were wounded by soldiers’ fire during the clashes.

Name: Bashar Haitham Ahmad Abu Zeid
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft, along with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, during a military, Border Police and Shin Bet invasion of the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. that lasted roughly three days. That day, a cancer patient traveling home in an ambulance was injured by fragments from Israeli forces’ fire. She died of her wounds on 19 December 2023. Another minor who threw stones and tried to throw an improvised explosive device at military jeeps near the hospital was also fatally shot. In the remaining two days of the invasion, six more Palestinians were killed, all operatives of armed groups, two more of them minors. Dozens of Palestinians were arrested.

Name: Musa Ahmad Musa Khatib
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers while throwing stones and trying to throw an improvised explosive device at military jeeps during clashes that broke out near Khalil a-Salman Hospital in the city during an invasion of the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. by the military, Border Police and Shin Bet that lasted about three days. That day, a cancer patient traveling home in an ambulance was injured by fragments from Israeli forces’ fire. She died of her wounds on 19 December 2023. Four more Palestinians, a minor and three armed operatives, were struck by a missile fired from an aircraft and either killed or wounded and died later. In the remaining two days of the invasion, six more Palestinians were killed, all operatives of armed groups, two of them minors. Dozens of Palestinians were arrested.

Name: Rafiq Muhammad 'Omar Izqeili
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft, along with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, including another minor, when they threw explosive devices and fired at a military, Border Police and Shin Bet force that invaded the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. and remained there for about three days. Two other military wing operatives were killed during a fire exchange, one in the camp and the other in the city. Over the next two days, seven more Palestinians were killed or died of their wounds, including two minors and three operatives in armed groups, and dozens of Palestinians were arrested.

Name: Thaer Shadi Fawaz Tabaji
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft, along with three other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, including another minor, when they threw explosive devices and fired at a military, Border Police and Shin Bet force that invaded the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. and remained there for about three days. Two other military wing operatives were killed during a fire exchange, one in the camp and the other in the city. Over the next two days, seven more Palestinians were killed or died of their wounds, including two minors and three operatives in armed groups, and dozens of Palestinians were arrested.

Name: Maher 'Abdallah Ahmad Jawabreh
Notes: Shot in the head by soldiers or Shin Bet forces while throwing stones at them during clashes that broke out after they entered the camp and arrested two Palestinians. During the clashes, Palestinian youths placed obstacles on the road, threw stones and explosive devices at the Israeli forces and fired at them. Five other Palestinians, including two Islamic Jihad military wing operatives, were killed in a fire exchange and six Palestinians were wounded. One of the wounded died of his wounds the next day.

Name: 'Omar Mahmoud Sadeq Abu Baker
Notes: Shot in the chest by Israeli forces when throwing stones at them during clashes in which Palestinian youths threw improvised explosive devices and fired at the forces that entered the town. According to media reports, three more Palestinians were injured by the Israeli forces' fire. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman 'Imad Khaled Bani 'Odeh
Notes: Killed by Israeli forces’ fire while throwing stones and burning tires during clashes that broke out after a military, Border Police and Shin Bet force entered the town and arrested three Palestinians. During clashes that developed in the area, armed Palestinians fired and threw explosive devices at the forces. Another contingent of Israeli armed forces entered the nearby al-Far’ah R.C., arrested Palestinians, and, during the clashes that broke out there, killed a Palestinian youth who threw stones at them. According to media reports, 11 more Palestinians were injured by the Israeli forces' fire in the town and the camp, including at least one minor.

Name: Yazan Majdi Munir 'Akub
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at al-Marb’ah Checkpoint after, according to the military, drawing a knife and advancing towards the soldiers.

Name: Basel Suliman Tawfiq Abu al-Wafa
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers while trying to set off an improvised explosive device as Israeli forces were retreating from Jenin R.C. The soldiers fatally shot another minor who tried to flee after throwing stones. During the incursion into the camp, two senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft.

Name: Adam Samer 'Othman Ghul
Notes: Shot in the head by soldiers while trying to flee them after throwing stones at military jeeps with other teens as Israeli forces were retreating from Jenin R.C. The soldiers fatally shot another minor who tried to set off an improvised explosive device. During the incursion into the camp, two senior Islamic Jihad military wing operatives were killed by a missile fired from an aircraft.

Name: 'Amru Ahmad Jamil Abu Wahdan
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers and Border Police officers from inside a military jeep while throwing stones at them with other teens from a rooftop as the Israeli forces were retreating from the city after arresting two Palestinians. During the arrest operation, clashes that included fire exchanges broke out in the city.

Name: Malek Majed 'Abd al-Fatah Dagharah
Notes: Shot by soldiers while trying to place obstacles on the road together with another youth, after the soldiers arrested a Palestinian in the village. Died of his wounds shortly after.

Name: Muhammad Riyad Fathi Saleh
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers when trying to flee after throwing an empty bottle at the Psagot settlement gate.

Name: 'Ammar Muhammad Feisal Abu al-Wafa
Notes: Shot in the abdomen, hand and thigh by soldiers while participating in clashes that included gunfire and explosive device throwing at soldiers and Border Police officers who entered the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. and arrested Palestinians. Two more Palestinians were killed in the incident, one of them also a minor. Another minor was killed while watching the clashes from the window of his house. An Islamic Jihad military wing operative was killed by a missile strike.

Name: Mahmoud Khaled Mahmoud Abu al-Heija
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers while watching clashes that included explosive device throwing and gunfire from the window of his house. The clashes broke out after soldiers and Border Police officers entered the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. and arrested Palestinians. Two other minors who participated in the clashes were killed and an Islamic Jihad military wing operative was killed by a missile strike in the same incident.

Name: Ahmad Muhammad Hamed Abu al-Heija
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers along with another Palestinian when they participated in clashes that included gunfire and explosive device throwing at soldiers and Border Police officers who entered the city of Jenin and Jenin R.C. and arrested Palestinians. Two more minors were killed in the incident, one of them while watching the clashes from the window of his house. An Islamic Jihad military wing operative was killed by a missile strike.

Name: Muhammad Ibrahim Fahed Bahlul
Notes: Wounded in the chest by soldiers' fire while standing in the street during their incursion into the town.

Name: 'Iz a-Din Mustafa Muhammad al-Hafi
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers and Border Police officers when riding a scooter past youths who were throwing stones at military jeeps that entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. In a video posted on social media, al-Hafi is seen riding a scooter around some youths who were throwing stones at the forces and then fled.

Name: Mu'taz Anas Subhi Mansur
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers during their incursion into the village, while youths threw stones at them.

Name: Muhammad Musa Muhammad Masimi
Notes: Killed inside the Fatah central headquarters in the camp when it was bombed, along with three al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operatives, one of them a senior operative. Earlier, an al-Aqsa Martyrs' Brigade operative was accidentally shot by armed Palestinians. Clashes broke out following the Israeli forces’ incursion, during which Palestinians fired at them.

Name: Nasrallah 'Abd al-'Afo 'Abd al-Fatah al-Qawasmi
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers, Border Police officers and security guards at a checkpoint along with two other Hamas military wing operatives after they opened fire on members of the Israeli forces, wounding six of them, including a soldier who died of his wounds shortly after. Israel is holding their bodies.

Name: Sharif Ahmad 'Abd a-Rahim Sha'er
Notes: Wounded in the pelvis by military and Border Police gunfire during a fire exchange that broke out after the Israeli forces entered the camp and arrested more than 20 Palestinians. Fifteen other Palestinians were killed, either on the spot or later from wounds they sustained, by the Israeli forces’ gunfire, including four more minors, one of them an operative with an armed group, and eight other members of armed groups.

Name: Muhammad 'Ali Muhammad 'Eziyah
Notes: Wounded by Israeli forces’ gunfire while on his rooftop during clashes that broke out after soldiers and Border Police officers entered the camp and arrested seven Palestinians. Soldiers stopped his father's car on its way to take him to a hospital and arrested him, injured. The military soon after notified the family their son had died of his wounds and his body was handed over to them later that morning at the a-Nashash checkpoint. The military claims that during operations in ‘Ayidah R.C. and a-Duheisheh R.C. that day, Palestinians threw Molotov cocktails and explosive devices at the soldiers.

Name: Ahmad Mahmoud Shafiq Khalaf
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers and Border Police officers in a fire exchange that broke out after they entered the camp and arrested more than 20 Palestinians. Fifteen other Palestinians were killed, either on the spot or later from wounds they sustained, by the Israeli forces’ gunfire, including four more minors, and seven other members of armed groups. Khalaf was an Islamic Jihad military wing operative.

Name: Muhammad Yusef 'Azzam Zayed
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers and Border Police officers while throwing stones and explosive devices, along with other youths, at military jeeps that were exiting the camp after arresting more than 20 Palestinians. Fifteen other Palestinians were killed, either on the spot or later from wounds they sustained, by the Israeli forces’ gunfire, including four more minors, one of them an operative with an armed group, and eight other members of armed groups.

Name: Lutfi Sayel Mahmoud Turkman
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while near armed men who participated in a fire exchange with soldiers and Border Police officers, which broke out after they entered the camp and arrested more than 20 Palestinians. Fifteen other Palestinians were killed, either on the spot or later from wounds they sustained, by the Israeli forces’ gunfire, including four more minors, one of them an operative with an armed group, and eight other members of armed groups.

Name: Qays Raed Rafiq Dweikat
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while participating in a fire exchange with soldiers and Border Police officers, which broke out after they entered the camp and arrested more than 20 Palestinians. Fifteen other Palestinians were killed, either on the spot or later from wounds they sustained, by the Israeli forces’ gunfire, including four more minors, one of them an operative with an armed group, and eight other members of armed groups.

Name: Muhammad 'Omar Ghanam Froukh
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers after stabbing two of them, critically wounding one and lightly wounding another. The critically wounded officer died of her injuries later that day. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Rami 'Iz Musa 'Odeh
Notes: Wounded by soldiers’ gunfire while standing on his balcony during their withdrawal from the town after arresting Palestinians.

Name: Muhammad Wael 'Ata al-Ja'bari
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers when throwing stones at them during clashes that broke out following a protest against the Gaza war.

Name: Hamzah Zayed 'Eid Sawaftah
Notes: Fatally shot by soldiers at a checkpoint, after, according to the military, speeding towards them on his car and then getting out of it holding a knife. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Yamen Mahmoud Nabil Jarar
Notes: Killed by a missile fired from an aircraft while participating in a fire exchange with soldiers who had entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. Another Islamic Jihad military wing operative, a Palestinian citizen of Israel, was also killed by a missile. A few hours earlier, the soldiers killed two other armed men. Another Palestinian who was standing on the balcony of his house watching the military jeeps leaving the camp was fatally shot in the city of Jenin.

Name: Ayham Muhammad Talal Shaf'i
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers while trying to find cover after throwing stones at them with other teens as the soldiers were retreating from the city after arresting three Palestinians. Two other Palestinians were wounded by soldier fire during the clashes and another Palestinian who was watching the clashes was fatally shot.

Name: 'Abd a-Rahman Muhammad Hassan al-Jawabrah
Notes: Shot in the chest by soldiers who were standing on the roof of a house while throwing stones at soldiers on the ground along with other youths during clashes that developed after a demonstration against the war in Gaza.

Name: Adam Naser Mahmoud Abu al-Hawa
Notes: Fatally shot by Border Police officers at the end of a short chase on foot after he stabbed a Border Police officer. According to media reports, the officer was severely wounded. Israel is holding his body.

Name: Musa Khaled Musa Jabarin
Notes: Killed by a missile strike while participating in clashes that included fire exchanges and explosive device throwing during an incursion into the camp by soldiers, Border Police officers and Shin Bet. Three armed Palestinians were killed in the fire exchange, including two other Islamic Jihad military wing operatives.

Name: Muhammad 'Abd al-Qader Jaber Kharaz
Notes: Wounded in the buttock and leg by shots fired by soldiers in ambush as he was about to throw a stone at a military jeep that was passing by, near the site of clashes between the soldiers and the Palestinians. Two other Palestinians who were driving by were injured in the incident, including a minor who died of his injuries on 2 November 2023.

Name: Hamdan 'Omar Mahmoud Hamdan
Notes: Wounded in the head from shots fired by soldiers at whom Palestinian youths were throwing stones, while driving by with his uncle. His uncle was lightly injured by the gunfire. A minor who was about to throw a stone at one of the jeeps passing through the area was injured during the clashes and died of his injuries on 31 October 2023.

Name: Yamen Kamal Ahmad 'Atiq
Notes: Wounded by gunfire shot by soldiers and Border Police while clashing with them along with other youths after the forces entered the city and, according to media reports, arrested four Palestinians. According to the military, during the clashes the Palestinians threw explosives at the forces and exchanged fire with them.

Name: Jawwad 'Abd a-Salam Turki Qatban
Notes: Shot in the back and chest by Israeli forces after throwing stones at them during clashes, which included fire exchanges, that broke out after soldiers and undercover Border Police officers entered the camp and arrested Palestinians. Two armed men, including a senior Islamic Jihad military wing operative were killed in the fire exchange.

Name: Usayed Hamzah Mahmoud Hmeidat
